paper_meta.Paper_title: A sample-to-answer, quantitative real-time PCR system with low-cost, gravity-driven microfluidic cartridge for rapid detection of SARS-CoV-2, influenza A/B, and human papillomavirus 16/18.

protocols.Paper_title: Development of Innovative Microfluidic Polymeric Technologies for Point-of-care & Integrated Diagnostics Devices
Methods: other:no experimental protocol described on provided pages (front matter: title/certification/contents/introduction heading only)

protocols.Paper_title: Development of Innovative Microfluidic Polymeric Technologies for Point-of-care & Integrated Diagnostics Devices (PhD thesis)
Methods: other:No specific sample-prep protocol described on provided pages; only general discussion of diagnostic cycle and possible preparation tasks (e.g., centrifugation, filtration, dilution, extraction) without an implemented procedure.

protocols.Paper_title: Development of Innovative Microfluidic Polymeric Technologies for Point-of-care & Integrated Diagnostics Devices (PhD thesis, Dublin City University, 2010)
Methods: other:No explicit sample-preparation protocol described on provided pages; only high-level discussion of approaches (e.g., bacteria capture, lysis, RNA amplification/NASBA) and device concepts.

protocols.Paper_title: A sample-to-answer, quantitative real-time PCR system with low-cost, gravity-driven microfluidic cartridge for rapid detection of SARS-CoV-2, influenza A/B, and human papillomavirus 16/18.
Methods: other:no sample-preparation protocol described on provided pages (content is thesis chapter text and references; no experimental workflow details)

protocols.Paper_title: A sample-to-answer, quantitative real-time PCR system with low-cost, gravity-driven microfluidic cartridge for rapid detection of SARS-CoV-2, influenza A/B, and human papillomavirus 16/18.
Methods: other:no explicit sample-prep protocol described on provided pages (general lab-on-a-chip overview; mentions that microfluidic devices can perform steps such as filtration, pre-concentration, washing, mixing, purification, isolation, separation; no concrete conditions)

protocols.Paper_title: A Point-of-care Microfluidic Sedimentation Cytometer (POC-SeCy) for Milk Quality and Bovine Mastitis Monitoring
Methods: other:centrifugal sedimentation in a rotating CD-like microfluidic disc to separate somatic cells (pellet) and fat (cream band) for measurement; no reagents/sample preparation reported

protocols.Paper_title: A Point-of-care Microfluidic Sedimentation Cytometer for Milk Quality and Bovine Mastitis Monitoring (Chapter 3, thesis excerpt shown)
Methods: other:gravity-/centrifugal sedimentation in microfluidic disc (sample loaded into inlet; disc spun to separate cream band and cell pellet for imaging-based cell counting)

protocols.Paper_title: A Point-of-care Microfluidic Sedimentation Cytometer for Milk Quality and Bovine Mastitis Monitoring
Methods: other:gravity-driven loading of raw milk into a CD-based microfluidic sedimentation cytometer (SeCy) followed by rotational sedimentation (disc spinning) and optical imaging/analysis of cream band and cell pellet

protocols.Paper_title: A Point-of-care Microfluidic Sedimentation Cytometer for Milk Quality and Bovine Mastitis Monitoring
Methods: other:centrifugal/microfluidic sedimentation (spinning to form cell pellet in channel)
